indexterm.primary: Administration tool to manage the required inventory for cdsls

refnamediv.refpurpose: Administration tool to manage the required inventory for cdsls

refsect1.title: Note
refsect1.para: The command com-cdslinvadm replaces the obsolete command com-mkcdslinventory.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The com-cdslinvadm command provides all needs to administrate cdsl inventories. The different use cases are switch with the command option. The following commands are allowed.

refsect2.title: Create cdsl inventories
refsect2.para: The create command instructs com-cslinvadm to create a new cdsl inventory. This includes creating directories and symbolic links. Also an inventoryfile that defaults to /.cdsl_inventory (relative to the root and mountpoint) is created. It will further on hold all cdsl metadata. The resulting cdsl inventory needs to be linked together (mount --bind /.cluster/cdsl/nodeid /.cdsl.local).
The follwing settings migth be overwritten. Please change those only if you know what you are doing.

listitem.para: The CDSLTREE specifies the directory relevant to MOUNTPOINT and ROOT that will further on hold all cdsls. There you will find one directory for each nodeid and one for the default. The CDSLTREE will be automatically created by this command. Under the nodeid directories all cdsl files and directory can be found with there full path.

The CDSLTREESHARED specifies the directory where shared CDSLs are being stored. Shared CDSLs are children of hostdependent CDSLs that should be shared among all nodes. The CDSLTREESHARED will be automatically created by this command.

The CDSLLINK specifies the directory where each node will find its individual files and directories (the CDSLs themself). This directory will be automatically be mapped to their CDSLTREE counterpart CDSLTREE/NODEID. The CDSLLINK will be automatically created by this command.

The MAXNODEIDNUM specifies the amount of nodes that should be created (relative to CDSLTREE). If this setting is not specified the node directories will be created at CDSL creation time or read from the cluster configuration (found at /etc/cluster/cluster.conf). If no cluster configuration is setup it is recommendet to specify this option.

refsect2.title: List/Get/Set CDSL inventory properties
refsect2.para: Lists or gets and returns global parameters set in the repository file (--get/--list/--set).
This is mainly used for other scripts or programs requiring informations that can be queried from the cdsl inventory.
The commands might be used for informational purposes.

refsect2.title: List or get CDSLs from inventory
refsect2.para: Lists and returns all or single cdsls from the given repository (--getcdsl/--listcdsls).

refsect2.title: Add or remove nodes from CDSL inventory
refsect2.para: The commands add- or removenode are used to remove or add nodeids from or to the CDSL inventory.
The command then copies or removes the nodeids directory within CDSLTREE and removes or adds the node to the CDSL inventory.
If a node is added the DEFAULT directory will be use as template for the new node directory.

If the node is to be removed the node's directory will be moved to the current working directory with the node id as it's name. This behaviour can be overwritten with the option --force. This will physically remove the node's directory.

informalexample.para: Creates a new inventory and builds the infrastructure needed for creating cdsls. There will be 5 from 0 to 5 directories be found under /.cluster/cdsl. Writes all settings to the inventory file at /.cdsl_inventory.xml.

Creates a new inventory and builds the infrastructure needed for creating cdsls. Requires /etc/cluster/cluster.conf to read the node ids from. Writes all settings to the inventory file at /.cdsl_inventory.xml.

informalexample.screen: $ com-cdslinvadm list config_version: 2.0 default_dir: default maxnodeidnum: 3 tree: .cluster/cdsl link: .cdsl.local node_prefix: expandstring: .cdsl mountpoint: use_nodeids: True sharedtree: .cluster/shared
informalexample.para: Lists all parameters persistently set in the CDSL inventory file.

informalexample.screen: $ com-cdslinvadm listcdsls root: / /: var/lib/dbus var/tmp etc/blkid var/log etc/sysconfig/network var/spool var/local var/run var/lock var/cache var/account var/lib/dhclient
informalexample.para: Shows all CDSLs found in the current filesystem.
